body:
# LuckyFlow

[![API Documentation Website](https://img.shields.io/website?down_color=red&down_message=Offline&label=API%20Documentation&up_message=Online&url=https%3A%2F%2Fluckyframework.github.io%2Flucky_flow%2F)](https://luckyframework.github.io/lucky_flow)

LuckyFlow is a library for testing user flows in the browser. It is similar to
Ruby's Capybara.

![LuckyFlow example](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22394/40257158-1a2f30b8-5abb-11e8-90c2-94463638e65d.png)

## Installation in [Lucky](https://luckyframework.org) projects

LuckyFlow is already installed and configured. Check out the guides
to see how to use it: https://luckyframework.org/guides/browser-tests/

## Installation in other Crystal projects

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
development_dependencies:
  lucky_flow:
    github: luckyframework/lucky_flow
```

Configure LuckyFlow in `spec/spec_helper.cr`:

```crystal
require "lucky_flow"

LuckyFlow.configure do |settings|
  # This is required
  settings.base_uri = "http://localhost:<port>"

  # Optional settings. Defaults are shown here
  settings.retry_delay = 10.milliseconds
  settings.stop_retrying_after = 1.second
  settings.screenshot_directory = "./tmp/screenshots"
  settings.browser_binary = "/Applications/Brave Browser.app/Contents/MacOS/Brave Browser"
end

# Put this at the bottom of the file.
# If a required setting is missing, this will catch it.
Habitat.raise_if_missing_settings!
```

Then view the guides: https://luckyframework.org/guides/browser-tests/

You should be ready to go!

For use with some of the Lucky shards (including Lucky itself), you'll need
to require a few extensions:

```crystal
# This extension adds an override to `visit` allowing you
# to pass in a Lucky::Action.class or Lucky::RouteHelper
require "lucky_flow/ext/lucky"

# This extension adds a `fill_form` method that you can pass
# an Operation or SaveOperation to which will populate form
# fields for you
require "lucky_flow/ext/avram"

# Similar to the Lucky extension, this gives an additional override
# to `visit` that allows you to visit a page as a specific User
require "lucky_flow/ext/authentic"
```

## Usage

> Note that you can only pass string paths to `visit` since only Lucky has
> route helpers described in the guide below. Example: `visit "/my-path"`

View guide at: https://luckyframework.org/guides/browser-tests/

## Contributing

1. Fork it ( https://github.com/luckyframework/lucky_flow/fork )
1. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
1. Install docker and docker-compose: https://docs.docker.com/compose/install/
1. Run `script/setup`
1. Make your changes
1. Run `script/test` to run the specs, build shards, and check formatting
1. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
1. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
1. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [paulcsmith](https://github.com/paulcsmith) Paul Smith - creator, maintainer

types.name: AuthenticLuckyFlowHelpers
types.doc:
If you have [Authentic](https://github.com/luckyframework/authentic)
required, you can require this file for some additional helpers
types.summary: If you have Authentic required, you can require this file for some additional helpers

instance_methods.name: visit
instance_methods.args_html: (action : Lucky::Action.class, as user : User)

def.name: visit
def.body:
url = route_helper.url
uri = URI.parse(url)
if uri.query
  url = url + "&backdoor_user_id=#{user.id}"
else
  if uri.query.nil?
    url = url + "?backdoor_user_id=#{user.id}"
  end
end
driver.visit(url)

types.name: AvramLuckyFlowHelpers
types.doc:
If you have [Avram](https://github.com/luckyframework/avram)
required, you can require this file for some additional helpers
types.summary: If you have Avram required, you can require this file for some additional helpers

instance_methods.name: fill_form
instance_methods.doc:
Fill a form created by Lucky that uses an Avram::SaveOperation

Note that Lucky and Avram are required to use this method

```
fill_form QuestionForm,
  title: "Hello there!",
  body: "Just wondering what day it is"
```
instance_methods.summary: Fill a form created by Lucky that uses an Avram::SaveOperation
instance_methods.args_html: (form : Avram::SaveOperation.class | Avram::Operation.class, **fields_and_values)

def.name: fill_form
def.body:
fields_and_values.each do |name, value|
  element = field("#{form.param_key}:#{name}")
  if element.tag_name == "select"
    self.select(element, value.to_s)
  else
    self.fill(element, with: value)
  end
end

types.doc:

required, you can require this file for some additional helpers
types.summary: If you have Lucky required, you can require this file for some additional helpers

constants.name: HABITAT_SETTINGS
constants.value: [{decl: screenshot_directory : String = "./tmp/screenshots", example: nil, validation: nil}, {decl: base_uri : String, example: nil, validation: nil}, {decl: retry_delay : Time::Span = 10.milliseconds, example: nil, validation: nil}, {decl: stop_retrying_after : Time::Span = 1.second, example: nil, validation: nil}, {decl: driver_path : String | ::Nil, example: nil, validation: nil}] of Nil

instance_methods.name: append
instance_methods.doc:
Add text to the end of a field

```
fill("comment:body", with: "Lucky is:")

append("comment:body", " So much fun!")
```
instance_methods.summary: Add text to the end of a field

instance_methods.name: fill
instance_methods.doc:
Set the text of a form field, clearing any existing text

```
fill("comment:body", with: "Lucky is great!")
```
instance_methods.summary: Set the text of a form field, clearing any existing text

instance_methods.name: open_screenshot
instance_methods.args_string: (process = Process, time = Time.utc, fullsize = false) : Void
instance_methods.args_html: (process = Process, time = Time.utc, fullsize = false) : Void

def.name: open_screenshot
def.body:
filename = generate_screenshot_filename(time)
take_screenshot(filename, fullsize)
process.new(command: "#{open_command(process)} #{filename}", shell: true)

def.name: pause
def.body:
puts("\nPausing to debug... (press enter to continue)")
STDIN.gets

instance_methods.name: select
instance_methods.doc:
Select an option from a select element

```
select("post:category", value: "rant")
```

If given an Array(String), the select is assumed to have the 'multiple' attribute
and will raise a `LuckyFlow::InvalidMultiSelectError` if it doesn't.

```
select("post:tags", value: ["rant", "technology"])
```
instance_methods.summary: Select an option from a select element

def.name: take_screenshot
def.body:
if fullsize
  with_fullsized_page do
    driver.screenshot(filename)
  end
else
  driver.screenshot(filename)
end

def.name: with_fullsized_page
def.body:
begin
  original_size = driver.window_size
  expand_page_to_fullsize
  yield
ensure
  if original_size
    driver.resize_window(**original_size)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: append
instance_methods.doc:
Add text to the end of a field

```
field = el("input[name='comment']")
field.fill("Lucky is:")

field.append(" So much fun!")
```
instance_methods.summary: Add text to the end of a field

instance_methods.name: fill
instance_methods.doc:

```
field = el("input[name='comment']")

field.fill("Lucky is great!")
```
instance_methods.summary: Set the text of a form field

types.name: Error
types.doc:
= LuckyFlow Errors

Generic LuckyFlow exception class.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (driver : LuckyFlow::Driver, selector : String, inner_text : String?, negate : Bool = false)
constructors.args_html: (driver : LuckyFlow::Driver, selector : String, inner_text : String?, negate : Bool = false)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(driver, selector, inner_text, negate)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: build
def.body:
String.build do |message|
  message << "Expected "
  if negate
    message << "not "
  end
  message << "to find element on page, but it was "
  if negate
  else
    message << "not "
  end
  message << "found."
  message << "\n\n  ▸ looking for: #{selector}"
  if !inner_text.empty?
    message << "\n  ▸ with text: #{inner_text}"
  end
  if (similar_flow_id && inner_text.empty?) && (!negate)
    message << "\n\n"
    message << " Did you mean..."
    message << "\n\n  ▸ "
    message << "'@#{similar_flow_id}'\n"
  end
end

def.name: match
def.body:
begin
  element = if text = @text
    flow.el(@css_selector, text)
  else
    flow.el(@css_selector)
  end
  if @visible
    element.displayed?
  else
    true
  end
rescue LuckyFlow::ElementNotFoundError
  false
end

types.name: FindElement
types.doc: Find element on a page with a retry
types.summary: Find element on a page with a retry

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (driver : LuckyFlow::Driver, selector, text inner_text : String? = nil)

def.name: run
def.body:
loop do
  matching_elements = find_matching_elements
  if matching_elements.first?
    return matching_elements.first
  end
  if has_retries_left?
  else
    break
  end
  sleep(retry_delay_in_ms)
end
raise_element_not_found_error

Used for checking missing settings on non-nilable types
It's advised to use base_uri in your apps to ensure
the propper type is checked.

types.name: Selector
types.doc:
Returns selector or transforms it into a flow-id selector

Example:

  Selector.new(".some-class").parse # => ".some-class"
  Selector.new("@new-comment-button").parse # => "[flow-id='new-comment-button']"
types.summary: Returns selector or transforms it into a flow-id selector

def.name: parse
def.body:
if should_select_flow_id?
  flow_id_selector
else
  raw_selector
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize do |_arg0|
  yield _arg0
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: fill
instance_methods.doc:
To set the value of date inputs correctly
you must put the year last
but it still submits the form with the date first
...any questions?
instance_methods.summary: To set the value of date inputs correctly you must put the year last but it still submits the form with the date first ...any questions?

def.name: midpoint
def.body:
midpoint = @inner_element.rect.try(&.midpoint)
if midpoint.nil?
  return
end
{x: midpoint.x, y: midpoint.y}

def.name: select_options
def.body:
select_el = ::Selenium::Helpers::Select.from_element(@inner_element)
if select_el.multiple?
else
  raise(LuckyFlow::InvalidMultiSelectError.new)
end
values.each do |value|
  select_el.select_by_value(value)
end

def.name: setup
def.body:
Spec.around_each do |spec|
      if driver_name = (spec.example._lucky_flow_all_tags & LuckyFlow::Registry.available).first?
        LuckyFlow.driver(driver_name)
      
end

      spec.run

      LuckyFlow.reset
      LuckyFlow.use_default_driver
    
end

    Spec.after_suite do
      LuckyFlow.shutdown
    
end

constants.name: VISIBILITY_XPATH
constants.value: "boolean(./ancestor-or-self::*[(((./@style[(contains(., 'display:none') or contains(., 'display: none'))] or ./@hidden) or ((name(.) = 'script') or (name(.) = 'head'))) or (not(./self::summary) and ./parent::details[not(./@open)]))])"

instance_methods.name: append
instance_methods.doc:
Add text to the end of a field

```
field = el("input[name='comment']")
field.fill("Lucky is:")

field.append(" So much fun!")
```
instance_methods.summary: Add text to the end of a field

def.name: attribute
def.body:
attr = _attribute(name)
val = attr.try(&.val)
if attr.nil? && (name == "value")
  val = ""
end
val

def.name: check
def.body:
if checkbox?
  set_checkbox(!checked?)
else
  if radio?
    set_radio
  end
end

def.name: click
def.body:
if link?
  method = (attribute("data-method")) || "get"
  (driver.as(LuckyFlow::Webless::Driver)).follow(method, (attribute("href")).not_nil!)
else
  if submits? && (f = form)
    (LuckyFlow::Webless::Form.new(f, @inner_element)).submit(driver.as(LuckyFlow::Webless::Driver))
  else
    if checkable?
      check
    end
  end
end

def.name: displayed?
def.body:
if (tag_name == "input") && ((attribute("type")) == "hidden")
  return false
end
if tag_name == "template"
  return false
end
(@driver.find_xpath(VISIBILITY_XPATH)).empty?

instance_methods.name: fill
instance_methods.doc:
Set the text of a form field

```
field = el("input[name='comment']")

field.fill("Lucky is great!")
```
instance_methods.summary: Set the text of a form field

def.name: select_option
def.body:
(@inner_element.xpath_nodes(".//option[@selected]")).each do |node|
  remove_attribute("selected", node)
end
(@inner_element.xpath(".//option[@value='#{value}']")).try do |el|
  (find_or_create_attr("selected", el)).val = "selected"
end

def.name: select_options
def.body:
if multiple?
else
  raise(LuckyFlow::InvalidMultiSelectError.new)
end
(@inner_element.xpath_nodes(".//option[@selected]")).each do |node|
  remove_attribute("selected", node)
end
values.each do |value|
  (@inner_element.xpath(".//option[@value='#{value}']")).try do |el|
    (find_or_create_attr("selected", el)).val = "selected"
  end
end

def.name: set_checkbox
def.body:
if value
  checked = find_or_create_attr("checked")
  checked.val = "checked"
else
  remove_attribute("checked")
end

def.name: set_radio
def.body:
if name = attribute("name")
  (driver.find_xpath("//input[(./@name = '#{name}')]")).each do |node|
    remove_attribute("checked", (node.as(LuckyFlow::Webless::Element)).inner_element)
  end
end
checked = find_or_create_attr("checked")
checked.val = "checked"

def.name: value
def.body:
if tag_name == "select"
  selected_options = @inner_element.xpath_nodes(".//option[@selected]")
  if multiple?
    selected_options.map do |option|
      option["value"]? || option.inner_text
    end
  else
    option = selected_options.first? || (@inner_element.xpath(".//option"))
    if option.nil?
      raise("expected select to contain an option")
    end
    option["value"]?.try(&.val) || option.inner_text
  end
else
  attribute("value")
end

def.name: submit
def.body:
form_field_xpath = if (id_attr = @form_node["id"]?) && (!id_attr.val.blank?)
  ALL_FORM_FIELDS_WITH_FORM_ID % id_attr.val
else
  ALL_FORM_FIELDS
end
form_field_nodes = @form_node.xpath_nodes(form_field_xpath)
form_field_nodes.reject! do |node|
  (submitter?(node)) && (node != submit_node)
end
form_values = form_field_nodes.compact_map do |form_field_node|
  case form_field_node.data
  when "input"
    parse_input_field(form_field_node)
  when "textarea"
    parse_textarea_field(form_field_node)
  when "select"
    parse_select_field(form_field_node)
  end
end.to_h
request_method = @form_node["method"]?.try(&.val) == "post" ? :post : :get
request_path = @submit_node["formaction"]?.try do |__arg1|
  __arg1.val.presence
end || @form_node["action"].val
request = (((::Webless::RequestBuilder.new.method(request_method)).path(request_path)).form(form_values, multipart?)).build
driver.submit(request)
